world. "His Mas:er's Voice" The way it has leapt into popular favour is extraordinary. Of course the public press has been givingit greatprominence, but the attractive nature of the dance itself has undoubtedly been the cause of its success.
Thousands of people all over the Kingdom are learning the steps to 'His Master's Voice' Tango Records. It's an ideal way ; you see the tempo is right and very few dance orchestras could play as accurately as ' His Master's Voice' Gramophone. The official steps for Engüsh dancing the pas rnarché, swaying, glissé, el corté, pivot, scissors and chass movements can be practised beautifully to the new records just published. There's La Rumba, Chispa, the Argentine and Maurice Tango—all the best-known of those quaintly named numbers, superbly performed by accomplished orchestras. A charmingly illustrated two-colour brochure is issued, giving lots of scintillating tango records get your copy to-day. Post free from us or at your dealers.
"His Masterfe Voice" Foot it to them, call at a dealer's to-day, and PRACTISE THE TANGO FREE AT 'His Master's Voice' DEALERS' Catalognes and adresses of dearleis free on application 22' Amst.
